message:
Added "--stream" option for top level test command

This is so that the full output from each sublevel of specs
is displayed.

Updated SASS build pipeline (#88)

Fixes #63

The problem, is that a vendor CSS file was not being inlined in our SASS build output, `styles.css`. This required the consuming application to have some sort of css loader via webpack, etc. to be set up. While some setups, like `create-react-app` setups do, others do not, and they would error out after including this project.

To resolve this, I had to find some mechanism outside of SASS to inline these files, since SASS does not support this.

I landed on using a plugin for `postcss`. To implement it, I did the following:

* Removed `node-sass-chokidar`, and installed `node-sass` and `chokidar` independently.
* I set up `chokidar` to explicitly watch our `.scss` files and run `node-sass` any time they change.
* I then run `postcss` with a css import plugin after running `node-sass`.
* Since this gave us a good entry for using other `postcss` plugins, I also added the `autoprefixer` plugin, which should help with backwards compatibility.

Another structural change I made was moving the more complicated scripts out of `package.json` and into `bin` files.

I also updated every package to have a `watch` script, that watches and rebuilds everything. This makes it easier to run a task like `lerna run watch --parallel` to watch and rebuild every single package in the entire project.

Documentation updates (#228)

- Added top level command for starting sandbox, for convenience
- Changed the recommendations for customizing component behavior to remove the mapViewProps function. It does not actually exist, and it's questionable whether it would actually be valuable. I added an alternate suggestion for overriding view props.
- I made much more thorough examples for autocomplete, because it seems to be hard for people to understand, currently.

Revert "Updated dependency versions"

This reverts commit 77a04a48af69036ea750863b9bc006856d3aa64f.

Fixed CI

Fixed CI by using the "--runInBand" option which runs all tests in
the same process. This was likely causing issues in CircleCI.

Updated Facet component to support quick search filter options (#248)

The Facet component has a search box at the top which lets you live filter facet filter options. It also supports accent-folding. e.g.

Search term lo will match LÒpez | logan | Logan

- Added new prop isFilterable to the <Facet /> component to enable / disable quick search.
- Implemented very basic accent-folding function.
- Added new story with Search to the <MultiCheckboxFacet /> component.
- Documented isFilterable prop usage.
- Added new tests for <Facet /> and <MultiCheckboxFacet /> component.

Switched SearchProvider to be a functional component with hooks (#469)

This PR changes SearchProvider to use hooks in advance of fixing #464.

In order for hooks to work within the local sandbox environment during
development, we needed to resolve an "invalid hook call" error.

A number of solutions are proposed here:
https://reactjs.org/warnings/invalid-hook-call-warning.html

In our case, the error stemmed from the fact that we link our
dependencies from sandbox to our packages. To resolve that, we
need to also link the react we use in our packages to the react we use
in the sandbox. 😵

I chose to add that linking automatically so that it happens
when running npm run sandbox, to make it seamless for developers.

Since that unfortunately causes issues running tests, as a result, I also added a new check
to tests to inform developers if they still have this linking in place.

Lastly, in our SearchProvider test we were inspect state directly on our instantiated SearchProvider component. That won't work now that it is a functional component using
useState, so we instead need to mock useState in order to access the underlying state.

Added engines property to package.json (#520)

The is so that we get some enforcement of node version
in development environments, which helps avoid some common
errors.
